data.name: Roll20 D&D 5e Style for Your Handouts
data.description: I admit this one is a little silly. After all, unless you share the style with your players, you're the only one who will see it. But if you find the default styles of Roll20 a little... pedestrian, this style will turn them into a close approximation of an official book. I haven't really done a lot of work on this, and for all I know it restyles something else important. But hey, here it is.

data.name: Roll20 More Compact Token Action ToolBar
data.description: This one is a companion to the Compact Macro Bar style above. It makes most of the same style changes in order to make the bar more compact, changing this:

data.name: Roll20 Add Rows to Map Tab
data.description: I thought this one was in here already, but it addresses some limitations to the map tab, namely dealing with many maps. This tweak will cause your page tab have multiple lines. The following code will increase it to three lines. It's a bit finicky to move pages, but the ribbon moves quite easily. Just move your cursor over the page you want to get to, you will see the page highlight, even though the flag is on the original row. Just release. The flag will move to and display on the correct page.

data.name: Roll20 Inline Links on OGL Template
data.description: If you dislike the big pink buttons that are served up by the OGL roll templates, and would prefer inline links that are less jarring and take up considerably less room, try this style. It also widens the max width of a roll template to better fill the available room in the chat tab.

data.name: Roll20 Compact Macro Bar
data.description: Here's a great bit of code I got from Roll20 user Vince that makes the macro quick bar smaller, more compact and centered, with a deeper shadow, turning this:

data.name: Roll20 Tiny Turn Tracker
data.description: The Turn Tracker can eat up a lot of screen real estate. Here's a style to make it a bit more compact.

data.name: Dark Mozilla Add-ons (AMO)
data.description: A dark theme for Mozilla Add-ons (AMO). For suggestions, contribution, or trying the latest development version, please check out the project on GitLab.

data.name: Youtube smaller thumbnails
data.description:
This is a theme for resizing youtube thumbnails to acceptable levels.

Be aware, you will still only have 8 thumbnails (instead of 10) on the front page. CSS can only change the styling and not add more videos.
